metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9963 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Exim before 4.87.1 might allow remote attackers to obtain the private DKIMsigning key via vectors related to log files and bounce messages.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.2
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.2
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.2
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.2
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.2
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.2').
